meanings.definition: The flat cutting edge of a knife or weapon.
meanings.sent1: She carefully sliced the bread with the sharp blade.
meanings.sent2: The chef sharpened the blade of the knife before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: The blade gleamed under the kitchen light, ready to cut through anything.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a blade, cutting through his defenses effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The blade of the knife glinted menacingly in the dim room.

meanings.definition: The flat, wide part of an oar or propeller.
meanings.sent1: He dipped the blade of the oar into the water and rowed steadily.
meanings.sent2: The boat's propeller blade spun rapidly, propelling it forward.
meanings.sent3: The blade of the oar splashed water playfully as he rowed.
meanings.sent4: The propeller blade sliced through the water like a hot knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The blade of the oar glistened in the sunlight as he rowed across the lake.

meanings.definition: A thin, flat part of a plant, such as a leaf or petal.
meanings.sent1: The green blade of the grass swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate blade of the flower petal in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The blade of the leaf danced in the wind, as if waving goodbye.
meanings.sent4: The blade of the plant reached towards the sunlight, seeking warmth.
meanings.sent5: The blade of the petal felt soft against her fingertips as she touched it gently.
